sentences.en: A coronation was a big event, like our president's inauguration.
sentences.cn: 在那个年代,加冕典礼是件大事, 更甚于现在的总统就职典礼.

sentences.en: At his coronation he received the homage of kings from Wales, Northumbria and Scotland.
sentences.cn: 在他的加冕典礼上，威尔士、诺森布里亚和苏格兰的国王向他宣誓效忠。

sentences.en: At the coronation, the archbishop put a crown on the Queen's head.
sentences.cn: 在加冕典礼上, 大主教把王冠戴在女王头上.

sentences.en: But the world began to warm in 1650; when Charles II was crowned king of England in 1660, the coronation sparked the Enlightenment era in Europe.
sentences.cn: 但是从1650年开始，全球开始转暖，当查理二世于1660年在英国即位时，他的加冕礼成为启动欧洲启蒙时代的转机。

sentences.en: It was also the place of coronation of the German Emperor.
sentences.cn: 它还曾是德意志君主的加冕之地.

sentences.en: King Vajiralongkorn's coronation will take place at some point after that.
sentences.cn: 哇集拉隆功国王的加冕礼将放在那之后。

sentences.en: Other web users identified the painting as being Catherine II the Great, Empress of Russia, with diadem and coronation robe.
sentences.cn: 有网友认出了这幅画像其实是俄国女皇叶卡捷琳娜二世，画中她戴着皇冠，身着加冕礼袍。

sentences.en: She was on her way to a coronation, not a campaign.
sentences.cn: 她是在加冕而非竞选,而且在最后, 她已经非常、非常接近胜利了.

sentences.en: Stunned, The King without a throne ducked the freaky coronation.
sentences.cn: 令人惊讶的是, 这位无冕之王躲开了这个看似有点滑稽的加冕典礼.

sentences.en: The coronation broadcast marked the arrival of television.
sentences.cn: 加冕典礼的转播标志着电视时代的到来。

sentences.en: The coronation of the new king was a pageant.
sentences.cn: 新国王的加冕典礼是一场极其壮观的典礼.

sentences.en: The coronation of the new king were a pageant.
sentences.cn: 新国王的加冕典礼非比寻常壮观.

sentences.en: The coronation was an occasion for extravagant myth and sentiment.
sentences.cn: 加冕典礼是极尽奢华和怀旧的仪式。

sentences.en: The coronation was conducted with great pomp.
sentences.cn: 加冕礼盛大而隆重.

sentences.en: The elderly King David was making arrangement for his son, Solomon's coronation.
sentences.cn: 这是老国王大卫王在吩咐属下为他的儿子所罗门的加冕典礼做准备.

sentences.en: The new stamps were issued to commemorate the coronation of the king.
sentences.cn: 发行新邮票以纪念国王加冕典礼.

sentences.en: The Pope was present at the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II.
sentences.cn: 教皇参加了伊丽莎白二世的加冕礼.

sentences.en: These stamps are a special coronation issue from 1953.
sentences.cn: 这些邮票是1953年发行的加冕礼特别版.

sentences.en: What they regarded as the end of life was the very preparation for coronation; for Christ was silent that He might live again in tenfold power.
sentences.cn: 她们所认为的生命末日，殊不知正是加冕大典的筹备过程；基督之所以静默安息，是为了在再醒时能增加十倍的力量。

sentences.en: When they first saw each other in royal clothing, the fine robes and shining crowns for their coronation, that was when they fell in love.
sentences.cn: 当他们第一次看到对方穿着王室的衣服——为他们的加冕礼而穿戴的精美的袍子和华丽的王冠——时，那就是他们坠入爱河的时候。

trans.tran_en: the ceremony at which someone is officially made king or queen
